description.narrative: - Increased delivery of good quality services for children through the community based approached developed with the Social Community Centres, Child Development Centres (CDCs), schools, primary health care centres and local child protection committees. - Social work practices for child protection are strengthened on community and institutional level in Abkhazia. - Knowledge, information and data collection on child protection is improved in order to strengthen the role both of families and communities to contribute to positive social change of the protection of vulnerable children in Abkhazia.

Projektet bygger vidare på arbetet som påbörjats under det tidigare projektet, 2010-2015, med Unicef och World Vision i Abchazien men har under denna fas fått ett delvis ändrat fokus. Syftet med detta projekt är att genom att bygga vidare på aktiviterna i och kring socialcentren, utvecklingcentren för barn med funktionshinder och hälsoklinikerna, öka kunskapen och förståelsen för barns rättigheter och problematiken kring grupper av särskilt utsatta barn. Parallelt med detta kommer man, för att förbättra hållbarheten i insatsen, även arbeta på övergripande nivå med att introducera socialt arbete som koncept och funktion samt ta fram ett kursprogram på universitetet för socialarbetare . Ca 12 socialarbetare och 20 socialassistenter kommer att utbildas och påbörja sitt arbete i två olika distrikt.
With a child protection focus the work by Unicef, partly in cooperation with World Vision include both special center for children with disabilities and capacity development of social workers.

tag.narrative: 1.3 - Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable.
1.3 - Införa nationellt lämpliga system och åtgärder för socialt skydd för alla, inklusive grundskydd, och senast 2030 säkerställa att de omfattar en väsentlig andel av de fattiga och de utsatta.

1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.

description.narrative: The results reported are in line with the overall objectives of the contribution. Some of the most important ones are briefly presented below; An achieved result in relation to the first mentioned objective of the intervention, is the progress made in shaping community-based approaches to the supplies of quality services for children in Abkhazia. The technical, professional and organizational capacities of the local stakeholders were strengthened and developed from the previous Sida-funded project “Community Support to Children and Youth in Abkhazia” that started 2011 and ended 2015, by the UNICEF and World Vision (WV). Technical training events were accomplished for different groups with a special focus on raising awareness on the child protection and approach. UNICEF also accomplished capacity building activities to develop psychosocial services by training local militia inspectors, social workers, representatives from the de facto, df Ministry of Labour and Social Protection (MoLESP) and df Ministry of Interior (MoI) in psychological first aid, crisis intervention and suicide prevention. Another achieved result in relation to the second objective are the piloting of the social work programme in three districts of Abkhazia. The first group of district-based social workers was recruited and trained in Gali, Guaduta and Sukhumi districts. The first 13 selected social workers took a pre-service training course on social work with the focus on gaining knowledge and skills to work with vulnerable girls, boys and their families. The activities performed by the social workers included awareness raising on social work and establishing cooperation with key stakeholders. It also included mapping available recourses and identifying the needs for the further development of social services. Lastly the activities included the direct work with individual child protection cases. Regarding the last cited objective, efforts were made to strengthen evidence-based approach to child protection issues in Abkhazia. Community based vulnerability records were developed and maintained by Steering Committees in 25 target communities, this allowed for analysis of different child well-being issues in the region. Monitoring practices were also introduced, and monitoring tools were developed within the social work pilot programme. An unexpected achievement the project contributed to was increased people-to-people dialogue between members of the main different ethnic local communities within Abkhazia. People of different ethnic background could meet, discuss and work together on a joint concern and at the same time exchange information and experience with one and another. A further result of this is a continuous cooperation among them with the shared aim of working for the well-being of children in Abkhazia. Some results on gender equality were also achieved from the intervention when gender-sensitive approaches were presented and used in the training of social workers. The training of the social workers included role-playing and interactive discussions around cases of children and caregivers of different genders. Forum Theatres were established and preformed with participation of youth and adults in the 25 targeted communities. The project made some progress on sustainability despite the complex context the project operated in. De facto authorities decided to cover running costs of the three CDCs from the df budget due to the advocacy of UNICEF and WV to mobilize local ownership of the CDCs. Consequently, the project increased local ownership and sustainability. Lastly there is a plan to collaborate with UNICEF and Abkhaz State University to promote the development of social work in Abkhazia as a profession through initially lectures.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
